parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To long for, covet, lust after, set the heart upon. From epi and thumos; to set the heart upon, i.e. Long for.
To fill, load. Transitive from gemo; to fill entirely.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From koilos; a cavity, i.e. the abdomen; by implication, the matrix; figuratively, the heart.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A husk (pod) of the carob. Neuter of a presumed derivative of keras; something horned, i.e. the pod of the carob-tree.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A swine, hog, sow. Of uncertain derivation; a hog.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Strengthened for a primary edo; used only in certain tenses, the rest being supplied by phago; to eat.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
